questions.question: What is the chemical formula of CUST-736?
At what temperature and relative humidity does CUST-736a achieve its maximum proton conductivity?
What method is used to measure the proton conductivity of the crystals?
How is CUST-736a obtained from CUST-736?
questions.answer: By removing the DMA molecules through solvent exchange and vacuum activation

questions.question: What is the role of DMA molecules in the channels of CUST-736?
questions.answer: They are interconnected with the amide group of TPBTC and sulfonic acid group of 2-H2stp through hydrogen bonding

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivity of CUST-736a is significantly higher than that of CUST-736.
What is the activation energy (Ea) of CUST-736?
True or False: The decomposition of the CUST-736 framework begins above 390°C.
What is the proton conductivity of CUST-736 at 80°C and 98% RH?
True or False: The morphology of CUST-736 changes significantly after the removal of DMA molecules to obtain CUST-736a.
What is the mechanism governing the proton diffusion in CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
True or False: The proton conductivity of CUST-736a is similar to those of other reported MOFs.
What is the maximum proton conductivity achieved by CUST-736a?
True or False: The sulfonic acid groups of 2-H2stp are arranged in an ordered and linear manner in the channels of CUST-736.
What is the role of water molecules in the proton conduction process of CUST-736 and CUST-736a?
questions.answer: Water molecules play a critical role in the proton conduction process

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivity of CUST-736 decreases after the removal of DMA molecules.
What is the activation energy (Ea) of CUST-736a?
How does the removal of DMA molecules affect the proton conductivity of CUST-736?
questions.answer: It increases the proton conductivity significantly

questions.question: True or False: The proton conductivities of CUST-736 and CUST-736a are governed by the Grotthuss mechanism.
What is the significance of the guest water molecules in CUST-736a compared to the DMA molecules in CUST-736?
questions.answer: Guest water molecules are more conducive to proton transfer than guest DMA molecules
